definition: surname Lu/abbr. for Luxembourg 盧森堡|卢森堡[Lu2 sen1 bao3]
(old) rice vessel/black/old variant of 廬|庐[lu2]/(slang) (Tw) troublesome/fussy

sentences.english: Luleng deems that public will is a sublimation of human's free volitions .
sentences.chinese: 卢梭认为，公意就是人类自由意志的升华。

sentences.english: Kants thought of freedom comes from that of Rousseaus, but also alienates it.
sentences.chinese: 康德的自由思想源于卢梭，却又不同于卢梭。

sentences.english: Kants thought of freedom comes from that of Rousseaus, but also alienates it.
sentences.chinese: 康德的自由思想源于卢梭，却又不同于卢梭。

sentences.english: Rousseau was one of the greatest thinkers of the French Enlightment Movement in the 18th century.
sentences.chinese: 卢梭是十八世纪法国启蒙运动中最伟大的思想家之一。

sentences.english: Rousseau emphasizes on labor education from the concept of natural education.
sentences.chinese: 从自然教育观出发，卢梭非常强调劳动教育。

sentences.english: Jean-Jacques Rousseau also noticed that private property makes man alienate.
sentences.chinese: 卢梭也看到了私有制使人产生异化。

sentences.english: J. J Rousseau was a famous French educational theorist in the Age of Enlightenment. Emel, J.
sentences.chinese: 卢梭是启蒙时期法国著名的教育理论家。

sentences.english: The division between sovereignty and government is very important in Rousseau's Democratic Theory.
sentences.chinese: 主权与治权的划分在卢梭的民主思想中具有重要意义。

sentences.english: The proprietor had a fine nickname: he was called Rousseau the Aquatic.
sentences.chinese: 那老板有个漂亮的绰号，人们称他为“水旅卢梭”。

sentences.english: Therefore Rousseau's student outlook is called an outlook of "looking upon children as children".
sentences.chinese: 因此卢梭的学生观可称之为“童道主义”学生观。

sentences.english: Luleng deems that public will is a sublimation of human's free volitions.
sentences.chinese: 摘要卢梭认为，公意就是人类自由意志的升华。

sentences.english: Rousseau's conception of history has surpassed that of his predecessors and his contemporary thinkers.
sentences.chinese: 卢梭的社会历史观超越了前人及其同时代思想家。

sentences.english: Among mountains of tribulation, nature, embraced Rousseau with her lenient heart.
sentences.chinese: 在重重磨难中，自然，以她宽厚的胸怀拥抱了卢梭。

definition: Baruch or Benedict Spinoza (1632-1677), rationalist philosopher
Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (1770-1831), German philosopher
Jean-Paul Sartre (1905-1980), French existential philosopher and novelist
Friedrich Engels (1820-1895), socialist philosopher and one of the founder of Marxism
Socrates (469-399 BC), Greek philosopher/José Sócrates (1957-), prime minister of Portugal (2005-2011)
Gustave Flaubert (1821-1880), French realist novelist, author of Madame Bovary
surname Althusser/Louis Pierre Althusser 路易·皮埃爾·阿爾都塞|路易·皮埃尔·阿尔都塞[Lu4 yi4 · Pi2 ai1 er3 · A1 er3 dou1 sai1] (1918-1990), Marxist philosopher
